description: First year of the third generation Dodge Charger, the 1971 was easily distinguished from its predecessor by the split grill in front. This new bold style featured hideaway headlights like what is equipped on this one as an option. This car specifically came from the factory with a 383 but was more recently changed to 440 cubic inch V8 that is backed up by a torqueflite 727 automatic transmission. Besides the changes to the drive train this Charger is very original and even features the optional luggage rack on the trunk lid! Other factory features that this car came equipped with are power brakes, power steering, leather interior, an AM/FM radio, and air conditioning (needs leak fixed). This classic American muscle car is ready to hit the open road and cruise in style! This vehicle is located in our Milwaukee showroom. You can view this 1971 Dodge Charger in greater detail including HD pictures and an HD video of it running and driving at Gatewayclassiccars.com. If you are interested in purchasing this vehicle or have more questions regarding it please call us at (262)-891-4253 or email us at Milwaukee@gatewayclassiccars.com.

description: 1972 DODGE CHARGER. This is a one owner Estate car selling it for the second owner. THIS WAS A LIMITED PRODUCTION CAR. IT ALSO IS A BUCKET SEAT AND CONSOLE CAR AS WELL. THIS CAR IS IN GREAT SHAPE AS ITS EXTREMELY SOLID NO RUST!! JUST PAINTED TO A VERY HIGH QUALITY ONLY 6 MONTHS AGO AND HAS ALWAYS BEEN GARAGE KEPT. BE ASSURED THIS CAR IS MAGNIFICENT. REALLY STRONG 440 ENGINE WITH NO ISSUES. THE TRANS SHIFTS SMOOTH AND IT RUNS DOWN THE ROAD GREAT!! ALL OF THE GAUGES WORK AS THEY SHOULD EXCEPT THE FUEL GAGE. CAR HAS A FUEL CELL IN THE TRUNK AS THIS IS THE WAY THAT IS WAS PURCHASED. THE LIGHTS WIPERS AND HEATER ALL WORK AS WELL. THIS IS THE YEAR THAT DODGE INCLUDED THE FLIP AWAY HEAD LIGHTS AND THIS CAR HAS THEM. THIS CAR HAS POWER STEERING AND BRAKES. AN EASY TROPHY WINNER AT ANY OF YOUR CAR SHOWS. THE STEERING WHEEL WAS CHANGER TO A MORE MODERN WHEEL BUT I HAVE THE ORIGINAL FACTORY WHEEL THAT IT WAS BORN WITH AND IT IS INCLUDED IN THE SALE. THE STEERING WHEEL IS LIKE NEW CONDITION. THE EXHAUST MANIFOLDS WERE CHANGED TO HEADERS MANY YEARS AGO, HOWEVER THE ORIGINAL EXHAUST MANIFOLDS ARE IN INCLUDED IN THE SALE, THEY ARE IN GREAT SHAPE. title: 1973 Dodge Charger

description: SUMMARY    * The beneficiary of a no-expense-spared rotisserie restoration  * Original 400 cubic inch B V8  * Original A727 TorqueFlite 3-speed automatic transmission  * Largely original sheetmetal / Correct Powder Blue paint  * Correct Bright Blue vinyl interior  * Factory air conditioning  * Factory power steering  * Factory power front disc and rear drum brakes  * 14-inch steel wheels  * Sale includes vintage service records and awards from various car shows    ----------    In the world of collector cars, some classics tend to overshadow their peers. If you're shopping Chevelles, you're probably looking for an LS6 Super Sport. If you're shopping Mustangs, you're probably looking for a first-generation coupe. And if you're shopping Chargers, you're probably looking for something between 1968 and 1970. That's a somewhat sad, but beneficial, phenomenon. Sad because it means a lot of great cars just don't get the respect they deserve. Beneficial because a lot of fine metal, like this classy 1972 Charger SE, can be purchased for very reasonable prices. As charming as it is cool, this award-winning hardtop wraps an original 400/3-speed drivetrain in warm blue aesthetics that are guaranteed to turn heads. It's the perfect way for any enthusiast to grab a neat old car and enjoy every aspect of the hobby!    BODY    Much nicer than when it rolled off Chrysler's St. Louis assembly lines, this slick hardtop is the beneficiary of a no-expense-spared rotisserie restoration that wrapped correct Powder Blue 2-stage around a largely original profile. That profile shows no signs of significant repair, suggesting it was a straight, trouble-free canvas before the car's metamorphosis began. Panel gaps are good enough to make painted pinstripes line up exactly right. Fresh chrome and highly polished stainless look great under bright emblems and a tight vinyl top. And overall, this fully sorted Dodge is a unique representation of a more luxurious era of Motor City mayhem!    DRIVETRAIN    Lift this Dodge's long hood and you'll find Chrysler's stalwart, 400 cubic inch B V8 that, introduced to replace the firm's venerable 383, is a popular choice for high performance builds thanks to its big bore, proven strength and excellent interchangeability. Behind that original mill, an original A727 TorqueFlite spins a 10-bolt axle. That smooth drivetrain feeds a fully sorted front torsion bar and rear leaf suspension that's shackled to factory power steering. Cool and confident stops are provided by a correct combination of power-assisted discs and power-assisted drums. Exhaust floats through a factory-style pipe and traditional turbo muffler. And at the corners of the floors, Powder Blue steelies spin G78-14 BF Goodrich Silvertown whitewalls around red-trimmed poverty caps.     INTERIOR    Swivel this coupe's level doors and you'll find a correct Bright Blue interior that reflects the luxurious push of early 1970s America. Broad seats, a split bench up front and traditional

description: PRICE REDUCED BELOW $30K! FIRM BUT VERY FAIRLY PRICED...A LOT OF CAR FOR THE MONEY!
This is a great looking SE that just had had thousands invested in the mechanicals to get the car running and driving like a Charger should.

It is powered by a rebuilt 440 Magnum engine with a 750cfm Edelbrock 4-barrel carburetor, Edelbrock intake manifold and a stock manifold flowing out through a recently replaced dual exhaust with Flowmasters. Absolutely everything on this car mechanically has been gone through and repaired or replaced where needed. We have a full list of receipts upon request.

The exterior is done in red with the proper black stripes, black spoiler painted in flat black and all of the emblems removed except the original 440 6-pack emblems on the hood. All of the chrome is in excellent condition, it is fitted with the fog lamp option and the pop-up headlights are fully functional. The glass is all original and is in great shape. The car sits on new 17-inch Retro wheels with BF Goodrich high performance tires.

The interior of the car is in incredible shape from the dash to the rear, from the carpet to the headliner…just like you would expect a restored Charger to look. It is an actual factory air optioned car that has just had everything replaced and recharged to current regulatory standards to be serviced at any shop. It has power steering, power brakes, a full set of gauges which all work properly and the original push button AM radio. The console and dash really are in exceptional condition for a 1971…restored or not. The bucket front and rear bench are in perfect condition.
This is a very nice running and driving ’71 Charger listed at an affordable entry price of only $29,995.00 firm or $316.00 per month with 20% down and approved credit.

description: Featured and up for sale in our Orlando Florida  showroom is a wonderful 70s Mopar, a 1971 Dodge Charger SE. This is a showroom quality, ground up restored, Charger that will be sure to please. The exterior is coated a beautiful metallic Plum Crazy Purple with a black stripe. Looking inside, you will find black vinyl bench seats and a solid dash with original gauges. Options include: AM FM radio, power brakes, power steering, seat belts, vinyl interior, radial tires, and chrome  wheels. Under the hood you will find a 440 CID V8 engine recently rebuilt to 1970 Specs backed by a newly rebuilt 727 automatic transmission. With only 70 miles since the restoration it features  Aluminum Intake, New Carburetor, Complete Rebuilt Suspension, Bubble Hood, New Brake Lines, The 1971 model year introduced a new third generation Charger that was characterized by a new split grille and more rounded "fuselage" body style. The interiors were like those of the E-body and were now shared by the Plymouth B-body, the Plymouth Satellite Sebring and Road Runner. Hidden headlights were now optional. This Charger is one of the last true Mopar muscle cars produced. Moving into the mid 70s, across the board you would find low rated horsepower, highly emission controlled cars of the future. This Charger will break away from the street light at lightning speeds and is still great for  highway cruising. If you are looking for Mopar muscle car that will not disappoint, look no further. The build quality speaks for itself. To view the car in greater detail, including an HD video and HD pictures, please check out www.gatewayclassiccars.com or our Orlando Florida showroom. Please call 407-771-2000 or email us at Orlando@gatewayclassiccars.com  for more information - See more at: http://www.gatewayclassiccars.com/orlando/1971/dodge/charger-S710.html
title: 1971 Dodge Charger

description: In The 1973 The SE Acted More As A Luxury Model. It Included Pleated Vinyl Seats, A Vinyl Roof, And Came Standard With The Rallye Instrument Cluster. A New Roof Design Gave The Car A Sportier Look And Included Stationary Louver Windows With Vinyl That Matched The Standard Half Vinyl Roof In Color. The Charger SE Used A Slightly Different Grille That Featured A Horizontal Bar Across The Center.     Features On This Car Include:    440 ci V8 â€“ Stroked To a 505 ci, Bored .30 over, Holley Dual Feed Carburetor Replacing The Original 318 CID  Electric Fuel Pump  509 Cam  Roller Rockers  Edelbrock Aluminum Heads  Open Element Air Cleaner  MSD Ignition  BeCool 4 Core Aluminum Radiator With Dual Electric Cooling Fans  Autometer Tachometer And Under Dash Gauges  March Aluminum Pulley System  Stainless Steel Braided Hoses  3 Speed Automatic Transmission With Floor Shift And Pistol Grip Shifter  Console  Trans Cooler  Power Steering (Aluminum Power Steering Pump System)  Power Disc Brakes (Front)  Rallye Dash Instrumentation Package  AM/FM Push Button Radio  Drivers Side Remote Mirror  Stock Steering Wheel  Hood Pins  Fender Mounted Turn Signal Indicators  Rear Deck Lid Spoiler  Factory Air Conditioner  Rear Window Defroster  Dual Flowmaster Exhaust System With Aluminized TTI Headers And Electrically Operated Dumps    Paint In Gold Metallic (Code JY6)  Black Vinyl Top  Medium Gold Vinyl Bucket Seat Interior (Code E6Y4)  BFG Raised White Letter Tires On Rallye Sport Wheels    PLEASE PHONE AHEAD TO ARRANGE TO VIEW THIS CAR AS IT IS LISTED OFF SITE    This is a consignment vehicle and the information above was provided by the current owner. We can make no guarantees as to the accuracy of the above information. However, please understand as with all pre-owned automobiles, the described condition is subjective . .     Worldwide Enclosed Door To Door Transportation / Financing Available
title: 1973 Dodge Charger

description: SUMMARY    * The beneficiary of a ground-up restoration / Freshly repainted in early 2017  * 426 cubic inch Hemi V8 / Tremec 5-speed manual transmission / Hydraulic clutch  * Customized interior / Modern audio  * Classic Auto Air conditioning   * Reilly Motorsports Street-Lynx 4-link rear suspension  * 8.75-inch rear axle / Sure Grip differential  * Power steering  * Wilwood 4-wheel power disc brakes  * 18 and 19-inch Boze Daytona wheels   * Dodge Viper Red paint  * Sale includes: Build receipts / Photos of the car's 2017 repaint / Component literature    ----------    The basic formula for building a show-stopping resto-mod is simple: find a popular muscle car, grab a stack of cash and start adding high quality components until every one of that car's compromises has been eliminated. Of course, perfecting that formula takes a rare combination of time, talent and vision, and this stunning Charger 500 is one of the lucky classics backed by all three. The beneficiary of a professional, ground-up restoration, this brutal road warrior is a no-holds-barred classic that's ready to parade the show field and dominate the stoplight. Every piece of the car has been carefully crafted with equal emphasis on performance and aesthetics. And if you're looking for an exhilarating way to enjoy a sunny summer weekend, its legendary Hemi V8, modern Tremec 5-speed and carefully upgraded suspension are all happy to oblige!    BODYWORK/TRIM    After spending most of its life as a solid driver, this clean coupe was the perfect starting point for a high-dollar restoration that decked a hot Hemi big block in savage MoPar attitude. To kick things off, the car's broad-shouldered body was massaged into tip-top condition. Once that metal was prepped and ready to spray, bright red 2-stage laid the perfect foundation for a traditional deck stripe. At that point, the car had been worked into a very nice classic that looked the part and drove the part. However, this Charger's current owner wanted something more than very nice, so he contacted Randleman, North Carolina's Petty's Garage:http://pettys-garage.com/g-19947-eddies-1970-dodge-charger.html and had the car freshened with a blazing coat of Viper Red 2-stage. When that brilliant profile was completely sealed and fully buffed, custom stripes were aligned around HEMI and 426 call-outs. And in early 2017, this Dodge rolled back onto the streets as a flashy, head-turning muscle car that tempers classic old school demeanor with a bit of new age panache!    The 1970 model is arguably the pinnacle of the second-generation Charger thanks to a stunning array of visual cues implemented by the good folks at the Chrysler Corporation. This 500 complements those factory pieces with a few subtle upgrades that maximize its visual appeal. Up front, a wide chrome grille hangs quick-spinning HID headlights above amber, LED parking lamps. Above that grille, a sculpted hood seats black-trimmed turn signal indicators opposite clean glass that's
title: 1970 Dodge Charger

description: THIS CAR IS PHYSICALLY LOCATED IN MILLIS, MA    What we have here is a nice 1973 Dodge Charger SE Hardtop with 95,391 miles on the odometer. This 70's muscle car is finished in White paint which is complemented by a Black vinyl roof and a White vinyl interior. Overall this is a good driver which will provide a ton of fun every time you take it out and at the weekend car shows.    This 1973 Dodge Charger SE Hardtop is a fantastic restoration project, she represents a great foundation on which to build. She is powered by her 318 cid motor with a 2BBL carburetor coupled to her automatic transmission; she has AC, Power Steering and Power Brakes.  The exterior and interior are both in good shape but the body and interior would benefit from a refurbishing. Cars like this and in this condition do not come to market that often so if you think this might be a car for you, do not hesitate to call and discuss a purchase.    If you enjoyed these cars back in the day, here is your opportunity to get back behind the wheel. We have priced this car to sell so if you are interested in a 1973 Dodge Charger SE, at a reasonable price, do not let the chance to own this pass you by. If you need any assistance with financing please let me know.    If you want to know the RESERVE on the car - CALL ME - (978) 771-8375    If you would like to talk about a Buy It Now purchase - CALL ME (978) 771-8375    My name is Paul please call me direct with any questions - my cell phone is always with me at (978) 771-8375 or you can email me anytime at paul@silverstonemotorcars.com     I promise you will enjoy your experience at Silverstone Motorcars.
